name: Generate & Upload Images with Image-to-Image GPT, Google Sheets & Drive
description:
### üñºÔ∏è Image-to-Image AI Generator from Google Sheets with Google Drive Upload
---

## ‚úÖ Use Case

Automatically generate AI images from prompts listed in a Google Sheet, upload the images to Google Drive, and log the result back into the sheet.

Uses the [`image-to-image-gpt`](https://rapidapi.com/PrineshPatel/api/image-to-image-gpt) API  for fast, customizable generation.

---

## üí° Problem It Solves

Manual image generation workflows are inefficient and error-prone. Creative and content teams often have to:
- Manually paste prompts into image generation tools
- Save images locally
- Upload to Google Drive
- Paste the link back into tracking spreadsheets

This automation removes all that friction‚Äîturning one spreadsheet into a complete image creation pipeline.

---

## üåü Benefits

- üîÅ Fully automated image generation
- üì§ Direct uploads to Google Drive
- üßæ Image links and timestamps logged in Google Sheets
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Built-in error logging for API failures
- üß© Modular and easily extensible
- üìä Keeps a historical log of successes and errors

---

## üß© Workflow Overview

| Node | Description |
|------|-------------|
| **1. Manual Trigger** | Starts the workflow when executed manually |
| **2. Google Sheets2** | Reads all rows from the input Google Sheet |
| **3. Loop Over Items** | Processes one row (prompt) at a time |
| **4. If2** | Filters only rows where `Prompt` is not empty and `drive path` is empty |
| **5. HTTP Request1** | Calls the [`image-to-image-gpt`](https://rapidapi.com/PrineshPatel/api/image-to-image-gpt) API with the prompt |
| **6. If1 (Error Handling)** | If an error exists in the API response, route to logging |
| **7. Google Sheets4 (Error Log)** | Appends error details to a log sheet for review |
| **8. Code1** | Decodes the base64 image returned by the API |
| **9. Google Drive1** | Uploads the image to a selected Google Drive folder |
| **10. Google Sheets1 (Write Back)** | Updates the original row with the image drive path and timestamp |
| **11. Wait** | Delays the next prompt to prevent hitting API rate limits |

---

## üõ† Tech Stack

- **n8n** (no-code automation)
- **Google Sheets** (data input/output)
- **Google Drive** (image storage)
- [`image-to-image-gpt`](https://rapidapi.com/PrineshPatel/api/image-to-image-gpt) API via **RapidAPI**
- **JavaScript (in Code node)** for base64 processing

---

## üìù Sheet Format

Your Google Sheet should include the following columns:

| Column         | Purpose                          |
|----------------|----------------------------------|
| `Prompt`       | The AI prompt to send to the API |
| `Image url`    | (Optional) Initial image URL     |
| `drive path`   | Updated with Drive link by flow  |
| `Generated Date` | Auto-filled by the workflow     |
| `Base64`       | Stores raw or error data         |

---

## üöÄ How to Use

1. Import this workflow into your **n8n instance**
2. Set up **Google Sheets** and **Google Drive** service credentials
3. Add your **RapidAPI key** in the HTTP Request node headers
4. Use the [`image-to-image-gpt`](https://rapidapi.com/PrineshPatel/api/image-to-image-gpt) endpoint in the HTTP request
5. Configure the Google Sheet and Drive folder in the respective nodes
6. Execute manually or add a Cron node for scheduling

---

## üìå Example Applications

- üõç **eCommerce**: Auto-generate product mockups
- üßµ **Fashion/Design**: Visualize styles or fabrics from prompts
- ‚úçÔ∏è **Blogging/Content**: Auto-generate header images from titles
- üì£ **Marketing**: Generate ad banners from text

---

## üß™ Tips

- You can add a **Cron node** if you want this to run on a schedule
- Use a separate tab/sheet for logging failed prompts
- Extend the flow by adding:
  - Email notifications
  - Slack alerts
  - File name templating

---
Create your **free n8n account** and set up the workflow in just a few minutes using the link below:

üëâ [Start Automating with n8n](https://n8n.partnerlinks.io/7fuarh1e6dz5)

Save time, stay consistent, and grow your LinkedIn presence effortlessly!

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

parameters.content:
# üß† AI Image Generator with Google Sheets & Drive

## üìå Purpose
Automatically generate images from prompts in Google Sheets, upload them to Google Drive, and log the link back to the sheet.

---

## ‚úÖ Key Benefits
- Zero manual effort to generate/store images
- Centralized prompt management via Google Sheets
- Drive integration provides shareable image links
- Built-in error handling and logging

---

## üß© Node Descriptions (One-liners)

**1. Manual Trigger**  
Starts the flow when you manually execute the workflow.

**2. Google Sheets2**  
Reads rows (prompts) from the connected Google Sheet.

**3. Loop Over Items**  
Iterates over each row from the sheet.

**4. If2**  
Filters rows: continues only if a prompt exists and no image is yet uploaded.

**5. HTTP Request**  
Sends the prompt to the AI image generation API (e.g., RapidAPI).

**6. Try Catch**  
Handles any API or logic errors gracefully.

**7. Google Drive**  
Uploads the generated base64 image to Google Drive.

**8. Set**  
Constructs a public share URL for the uploaded image.

**9. Google Sheets1**  
Updates the original sheet row with the Drive image link.

**10. Google Sheets3 (Logger)**  
Writes success/failure logs to a separate sheet or tab.

### 1. **Manual Trigger**
Manually starts the workflow for testing or controlled execution.

### 2. **Google Sheets2 ‚Äì Fetch Prompts**
- Connects to a specific Google Sheet.
- Reads rows that include prompts.
- These prompts will be used to generate images.

### 3. **Loop Over Items**
- Loops through each row one by one.
- This ensures each prompt is handled independently.

### 4. **If2 ‚Äì Filter Valid Rows**
- Checks two conditions:
  1. Whether the "Prompt" column has text
  2. Whether the "drive path" column is empty (i.e., not processed yet)
- If both conditions pass, the flow proceeds; otherwise, it skips to the next row.

### 5. **HTTP Request ‚Äì Call Image API**
- Sends a POST or GET request to the AI image generator API (like RapidAPI or Replicate).
- Includes the prompt as a parameter.
- Receives the image in base64 or URL form.

### 6. **Try Catch ‚Äì Error Handling**
- Wraps around the API call and upload step.
- If image generation or upload fails, the error is caught here and handled without breaking the loop.

### 7. **Google Drive ‚Äì Upload Image**
- Converts base64 image (if needed).
- Uploads the image to a specified Google Drive folder.
- Retrieves the public/shared URL of the uploaded image.

### 8. **Set ‚Äì Prepare Image Link**
- Formats the image URL from Drive to make it user-friendly or shareable.
- Prepares this value to update back into the sheet.

### 9. **Google Sheets1 ‚Äì Update Sheet**
- Writes the image link into the same row from which the prompt came.
- Marks the row as "processed" by updating the drive path field.

### 10. **Google Sheets3 ‚Äì Log Status**
- Appends a new row in a separate log sheet or tab.
- Records status (success/failure), prompt, and time.
- Useful for tracking flow execution over time.
This node is used to insert a delay before proceeding to the next step in the workflow. In your case, the node waits for `10 seconds`.
